At one of her last birthdays, we held 'Gwennfest' to have one last great party. Today, instead of being sad, I‚Äôm trying to capture that spirit, and smile thinking of all the good times. It‚Äôs hard, but it‚Äôs what mom would have wanted. 

We love and miss you, mom.

Her biggest fear was that we would forget her ‚Äî but there‚Äôs not a chance that could happen. 

She remains a big influence on my family, and she always will.
All she really wanted to do was speak about or see us and my kids. There was no more loving (or fun) grandmother. She loved to spoil my kids, and they still talk about her all the time.
Mom loved people and her smile lit up a room; she was always the life of the party. She was taken from us far too soon, but she faced her disease and last years with absolute grace and dignity.
I was blessed. Mom was always there for me and my sister. She never missed a game or an event ‚Äî or an opportunity to be supportive. She was my biggest champion and number one fan.

It‚Äôs hard to believe that it‚Äôs been three years since we lost my mom. There isn‚Äôt a day that goes by that I don‚Äôt think of her, miss her deeply, and recognize a simple truth: but for mom‚Äôs love and guidance, I wouldn‚Äôt be in Congress, or, frankly, have achieved anything. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E_IGtAMXMAMNAiN.jpg
